name: Overview

[{"id":"f469d03b-82f3-4277-a874-bbb4d64f6ef1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: get_scope_ns","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2c6b9e46-3883-43e6-861d-1f8263454efb","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_scope_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a structural lookup utility that identifies the nearest valid parent scope for a given namespace string. It takes a specific identifier (which might be a variable or a deep reference like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.class.method.variable","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and climbs up the dotted path until it finds a namespace that exists as a registered ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"scope_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"75c8eb07-7516-4026-b299-5029762275c5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In static analysis, definitions (like variables) often have longer namespaces than the scopes that contain them. For example, in the namespace ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.utils.process_data.timeout","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the actual ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"scope","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"app.utils.process_data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (the function), while ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"timeout","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is just a definition inside it. This function allows the analyzer to find the "container" for any definition, which is essential for determining variable visibility and correctly placing new symbols during assignment.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b3862d6f-c66e-4970-a412-46cc0a997a1f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"816a9128-37bb-4038-9b5d-6fb78086b79a","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dotted Traversal:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It accepts a namespace string (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"352f5b32-1342-4879-954b-c05cebde53b8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Validation Loop:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It checks if the current string exists in the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"scope_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s list of active scopes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ef2ba6ad-4ae4-47be-abbe-9a44342861ea","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Namespace Reduction:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the current string is not a valid scope, it truncates the string at the last dot (moving up one level).","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"3b7b38c3-28ca-4771-a2de-81f93676ad7a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pkg.mod.Class.var","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" → ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pkg.mod.Class","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"4cd4d01f-2d4c-4f6c-8c63-9b77bf2a5e10","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Termination:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The process continues until a matching scope is found or the string is empty.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fffb8a89-95bb-494a-ad24-18175bf1bdb3","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Output:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It returns the string of the found parent scope or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"None","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if no scope exists in that hierarchy.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5eb3d97c-b81c-4543-a453-96d21282457f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"If the analyzer is processing ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main_mod.Calculator.add.result","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (a variable inside a method):","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"94fabd91-7ebf-4914-9965-d9e425548992","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_scope_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is called with that full string.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9dae527b-3768-4de2-a7bb-21927373c647","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It checks ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main_mod.Calculator.add.result","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (No scope exists for a variable).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"80771683-90ad-4bff-9201-437c1d36e2fb","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It strips ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":".result","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and checks ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main_mod.Calculator.add","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"20bd348d-b307-4585-b871-556db398cd38","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Success:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" A scope exists for this method.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1e054986-b20b-4f07-bf2a-39c8e2139f5e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main_mod.Calculator.add","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The analyzer now knows that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"result","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" belongs inside the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method's scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3bc9fbf1-85c7-4698-93ab-4c10d5e2ef8c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
